00014 ## print a dictionary 
00015 def printDict(dict,sep=' = ' ):
00016         for key in dict.keys():
00017                 print key  + sep + dict[key]

00020 ## Makefile.am support class
00021 #
00022 # The class provides methods for the following tasks: 
00023 #               - parsing Makefile.am's and collecting targets and defines into class members 
00024 #               - extracting library dependencies and linker flags keyed by the related targets
00025 #               - extracting target libraries and programs
00026 #               - collecting detailled lists of libraries dependencies
00027 #
00028 #
00029 class AMFile: 
00030         def __init__(self):
00031                 self.defines = {}
00032                 self.targets = {}
00033                 self.libadds = {}
00034                 self.ldflags = {}
00035                 self.libs    = {}
00036                 self.progs   = {}
00037                 self.sources = {}
00038                 self.includes= {}
00039                 self.headers = {}
00040                 self.data    = {}
00041                 self.datadirs= {}
00042                 self.path    = ''
00043                 self.subdirs = ''
00044                 
00045         ## read and parse a Makefile.am 
00046         #
00047         # The resulting lines are stored in the defines and targets class member.
00048         # note: Multiple lines in a target are separated by '###'
00049         # @param path - path for Makefile.am
00050         # @return 0 if file couldn't be read 
00051         # 
00052         def read(self,path):
00053                 try:
00054                         src=open(path, 'r')
00055                 except:
00056                         return 0
00057                 self.path = path
00058                 
00059                 file  = src.read()
00060                 lines = file.replace('\n\t','###')
00061                 list = lines.replace('\\\n',' ').split('\n')
00062                 for line in list:
00063                         if line[:1] == '#' or len(line) == 0:
00064                                 continue
00065                         
00066                         index = 0
00067                         while line[index].count('#'):
00068                                 index = line[index].index('#')
00069                                 if line[index:index+3] == "###":
00070                                         index += 3
00071 
00072                         var = line.split('=')
00073                         if len(var) == 2:
00074                                 self.defines[str(var[0]).strip()] = var[1].strip().replace("'",'').replace('\###',' ')
00075                         else:
00076                                 target = line.split(':')
00077                                 if len(target) == 2:
00078                                         single_target = target[1].strip().replace("'",'')
00079                                         # TODO: (rh) split into list 
00080                                         self.targets[str(target[0]).strip()] = single_target
00081                 self.getLibraries()
00082                 self.getPrograms()
00083                 self.self.getIncludes()
00084                 self.getHeaders()
00085                 self.getSources()
00086                 self.getLibraryDeps()
00087                 self.getLinkerFlags()
00088                 self.getSubdirs()
00089                 self.getData()
00090 
00091                 return 1
00092                 
00093         ## adds library dependencies from another AMFile instance 
00094         #
00095         # This method is mainly used for an instance collecting definitions 
00096         # from instances from lower levels 
00097         # @param src - AMFile instance, from which the dependencies are imported 
00098         #
00099         def addLibraryDeps(self,src):
00100                 for key in src.libadds.keys():
00101                         self.libadds[key] = src.libadds[key]
00102                                 
00103         ## adds linker flags from another AMFile instance 
00104         #
00105         # This method is mainly used for an instance collecting definitions 
00106         # from instances from lower levels 
00107         # @param src - AMFile instance, from which the flags are imported 
00108         #
00109         def addLinkerFlags(self,src):
00110                 for key in src.ldflags.keys():
00111                         self.ldflags[key] = src.ldflags[key]
00112 
00113         def addSources(self,src):
00114                 for key in src.sources.keys():
00115                         self.sources[key] = src.sources[key]
00116 
00117         def addLibraries(self,src):
00118                 for key in src.libs.keys():
00119                         self.libs[key] = src.libs[key]
00120 
00121         def getSubdirs(self):
00122                 if self.defines.has_key('SUBDIRS'):
00123                         self.subdirs = self.defines['SUBDIRS']
00124                         del self.defines['SUBDIRS']
00125         ## collect all LIBADDS definitions 
00126         #
00127         # the function store the definitions in the libadds class member keyed 
00128         # by the relating target
00129         # @return definition list 
00130         #
00131         def getLibraryDeps(self):
00132                 reg = re.compile("(.*?)_(?:l?a_)?LIBADD$")
00133                 # TODO (rh) fix relative library pathes 
00134                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00135                         result=reg.match(key)
00136                         if result:
00137                                 libadd = self.findRealTargetname(str(result.group(1)))
00138                                 if not len(libadd):
00139                                         print "WARNING: no corresponding target for libadd item %s \n" % str(result.group(1))
00140                                         continue
00141                                 self.libadds[libadd] = self.defines[key]
00142                                 del self.defines[key]
00143                 return self.libadds
00144 
00145         ## collect all LDFLAGS definitions 
00146         #
00147         # the function store the definitions in the ldflags class member keyed 
00148         # by the relating target 
00149         # @return definition list 
00150         #
00151         def getLinkerFlags(self):
00152                 reg = re.compile("(.*?)_(?:l?a_)?LDFLAGS$")
00153                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00154                         result=reg.match(key)
00155                         if result:
00156                                 ldflag = self.findRealTargetname(str(result.group(1)))
00157                                 if not len(ldflag):
00158                                         print "WARNING: no corresponding target for ldflag item %s \n" % str(result.group(1))
00159                                         continue
00160                                 self.ldflags[ldflag] = self.defines[key]
00161                                 del self.defines[key]
00162                 return self.ldflags
00163 
00164         ## collect all LTLIBRARIES definitions 
00165         #
00166         # the function store the definitions in the libraries class member keyed 
00167         # by the relating target 
00168         # @return definition list 
00169         #
00170         def getLibraries(self):
00171                 def stripLibname(val):
00172                         reg = re.compile("(?:lib)?(.*)\.l?a$")
00173                         files = val.split()
00174                         retlist = []
00175                         for file in files:
00176                                 result=reg.match(file)
00177                                 if result:
00178                                         retlist.append(str(result.group(1)))
00179                         return ' '.join(retlist)
00180                 reg = re.compile("(.*)(_l?a)?_LTLIBRARIES$")
00181                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00182                         result=reg.match(key)
00183                         if result:
00184                                 libtype = str(result.group(1))
00185                                 if not self.libs.has_key(libtype):
00186                                         self.libs[libtype] = ""
00187                                 self.libs[libtype] = stripLibname(self.defines[key])
00188                                 del self.defines[key]
00189                 return self.libs
00190 
00191         def getPrograms(self):
00192                 reg = re.compile("(.*)_PROGRAMS$")
00193                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00194                         result=reg.match(key)
00195                         if result:
00196                                 progtype = str(result.group(1))
00197                                 if not self.progs.has_key(progtype):
00198                                         self.progs[progtype] = ""
00199                                 self.progs[progtype] = self.defines[key]
00200                                 del self.defines[key]
00201                 return self.progs
00202 
00203         def getData(self):
00204                 reg = re.compile("(.*)_DATA$")
00205                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00206                         result=reg.match(key)
00207                         if result:
00208                                 dat = str(result.group(1))
00209                                 self.data[dat] = self.defines[key]
00210                                 del self.defines[key]
00211                 for name in self.data.keys():
00212                         if self.defines.has_key(name+"dir"):
00213                                 self.datadirs[name] = self.defines[name+"dir"]
00214                                 del self.defines[name+"dir"]
00215                         else:
00216                                 del self.data[name]
00217                 
00218                 return self.data
00219 
00220         ## collect all SOURCES definitions 
00221         #
00222         # the function store the definitions in the sources class member keyed 
00223         # by the relating target
00224         # this function should be called after getPrograms and getLibraries
00225         # @return definition list 
00226         #
00227         def getSources(self):
00228                 reg = re.compile("(.*?)METASOURCES$")
00229                 reg = re.compile("(.*?)_(?:l?a_)?SOURCES$")
00230                 # TODO (rh) fix relative library pathes 
00231                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00232                         if key.endswith('METASOURCES') and self.defines[key] == "AUTO":
00233                                 del self.defines[key]
00234                                 continue
00235                         
00236                         result=reg.match(key)
00237                         if result:
00238                                 source = self.findRealTargetname(str(result.group(1)))
00239                                 if not len(source):
00240                                         print "WARNING: no corresponding target for source item %s \n" % str(result.group(1))
00241                                         continue
00242                                 self.sources[source] = self.defines[key]
00243                                 del self.defines[key]
00244                 return self.sources
00245 
00246         def findRealTargetname(self, target):
00247                 def findInDict(dict, target):
00248                         for key in dict.keys():
00249                                 targets = dict[key].split()
00250                                 if targets.count(target) > 0:
00251                                         return 1
00252                         return 0
00253                 if not findInDict(self.progs, target) and not findInDict(self.libs, target):
00254                         if target[:3] == "lib":
00255                                 target = target[3:]
00256                                 if not findInDict(self.libs, target):
00257                                         target = ""
00258                         else:
00259                                 target = ""
00260                 return target
00261         
00262         def getIncludes(self):
00263                 #if we've got a dir global includes, save it in self.includes['_DIR_GLOBAL_']
00264                 if self.defines.has_key('INCLUDES'):
00265                         self.defines['_DIR_GLOBAL__INCLUDES'] = self.defines['INCLUDES']
00266                         del self.defines['INCLUDES']
00267                 reg = re.compile("(.*?)_(?:l?a_)?INCLUDES")
00268                 # TODO (rh) fix relative library pathes 
00269                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00270                         result=reg.match(key)
00271                         if result:
00272                                 include = self.findRealTargetname(str(result.group(1)))
00273                                 if not len(include):
00274                                         include = result.group(1)
00275                                 self.includes[include] = self.defines[key]
00276                                 del self.defines[key]
00277                 return self.includes
00278 
00279         def convertMakeFileVariable(self, var):
00280                 var = var.strip()
00281                 if var[:2] == '$(' and var[-1:] == ')':
00282                         return var[2:-1]
00283                 else:
00284                         return var
00285 
00286         def getHeaders(self):
00287                 #if we've got a dir global includes, save it in self.headers['_DIR_GLOBAL_']
00288                 if self.defines.has_key('HEADERS'):
00289                         self.defines['_DIR_GLOBAL__HEADERS'] = self.defines['HEADERS']
00290                         del self.defines['HEADERS']
00291                 reg = re.compile("(.*?)_(?:l?a_)?HEADERS")
00292                 # TODO (rh) fix relative library pathes 
00293                 for key in self.defines.keys():
00294                         result=reg.match(key)
00295                         if result:
00296                                 header = self.findRealTargetname(str(result.group(1)))
00297                                 if not len(header):
00298                                         header = result.group(1)
00299                                 self.headers[header] = self.defines[key]
00300                                 del self.defines[key]
00301                 return self.headers
00302                         
00303         ## return a reverse usage list of dependencies 
00304         #
00305         # The function scannes the recent library definitions and reorganice
00306         # the resulting list keyed by the used library
00307         # @return dependency list 
00308         #
00309         def getReverseLibraryDeps(self):
00310                 alist = {}
00311                 for key in self.libadds.keys():
00312                         for lib in self.libadds[key].split():
00313                                 if lib in alist:
00314                                         alist[str(lib)] += " " + key
00315                                 else:
00316                                         alist[str(lib)] = key
00317                 return alist
00318         
00319         def printDefines(self):
00320                 print "### DEFINES:" 
00321                 printDict(self.defines,' = ')
00322         
00323         def printTargets(self):
00324                 print "### TARGETS:" 
00325                 printDict(self.targets,' : ')
00326 
00327         def printLibraryDeps(self):
00328                 print "### LIBADD:" 
00329                 printDict(self.libadds,' : ')
00330 
00331         def printLinkerFlags(self):
00332                 print "### LDFLAGS:"
00333                 printDict(self.ldflags,' : ')
00334 
00335         def printLibraries(self):
00336                 print "### Libraries:"
00337                 printDict(self.libs,' : ')
00338 
00339         def printSources(self):
00340                 print "### Sources:"
00341                 printDict(self.sources,' : ')
